pros: Great mentors, recognition and training!
cons: When classes don't fill up the course is cancelled.

pros: The work is plenty, the community culture is great.
cons: The pay is not appropriate to the work load.

pros: Benefits are ok, better than most companies.
cons: Administration is corrupt. You only get ahead if you're family or friends with upper management. Faculty are treated well, but staff are treated horribly. You are reminded how replaceable you are on a daily basis.

pros:

pros: Nice place and nice people, easy work, flexibile
cons: Pay is low, gets boring

review_title: Business disguised as a higher education college
pros: Adjustable schedule, close to home, ability to continue education
cons: No room for advancement and not willing to change policies and procedures to more current time period.

pros: Meaningful work when helping students. Supportive peers and free parking.
cons:
High PT workforce
High levels of burnout
Slow moving administration

review_title: DO NOT WORK HERE UNDER ANY CIRCUMSTANCE
pros: The sad fact is that this organization could do much to help their community, but chooses instead to use tax funding for their own personal gain.
cons: This organization is corrupt from the top. There are wonderful people who work here, but the administration is corrupt from the word 'go'.

pros:
The culture of caring ...from the people that actually believe in the mission and values of the college.  There are so many that out weigh the negative ones.  Just the negatives are hard to ignore long term. 

I started out as a work study student in another department and that experience was wonderful. I loved going to work most days and the rougher days were made better by my coworkers. Where I still wanted to be there.  You won’t find better than the office I started in. It’s truly an anomaly even in the organization it’s self.
cons:
On-boarding takes ages : took a year almost to get my access fixed in my first position even simple tasks such as adding a printer.   Then it took 5 more months to get access in my second position that never resolved by the time I left. ( part of my reason for departure.) Leaving me unable to do half of my tasks I could perform. 

- Some times people are so over worked or also untrained so you don’t get properly trained to do your job duties.  So it’s sink or swim. 

-Listening / comprehending : too many I have ran into are so over worked or have so much going on they barely read what an email says. Let alone comprehend it.  So don’t send an email more than 1 sentence long. 

Listening to what you say verbally is another issue.  It is a lost skill that many don’t possess here.  Many really need to take a communication class.  It got irritating to where you are left feeling you don’t want to talk to certain co workers for their lack of listening skills.

review_title: A good place to work with a busy schedule
pros: The scheduling is flexible and tends to be understanding of your classes!
cons: The pay can be low, especially if you're working under the Work Study government program

pros: Management, team work, government retirement
cons: A lot of down time,

job_title: Computer Resources Specialist in Elyria, OH
pros: Lorain County Community College goes above and beyond to help students be successful. The working conditions are flexible and benefits are good.
cons: As a public institution, the College is reliant on state funding, which can vary.

review_title: Great experience as a student worker!
pros: The staff you work with is great! As a student worker, hours are very flexible around a class schedule.  I kept track of my own hours, and really enjoyed that.  I highly recommend seeking employment for students looking to make some cash while in school.
cons: The hours of work were inconsistent, but I would imagine this was only for my position.  My duties were data entry for switching over to MyCampus.  Some weeks I had thirty hours of work and other weeks I had two hours.  It obviously would have been nice to make more than minimum wage, but the position didn't really demand more than that.

pros: I work at the Spitzer Conference and Dining Center. Pros include a relaxed work environment, potential for raises, bonuses, and promotions based on performance reviews, and great work schedule flexibility. Part-time employees get pension-based retirement benefits, which is practically unheard of. Pay is consistently above minimum wage.
cons: Maybe some favoritism within the office, but no worse than any other average office climate. People that slack off or call off generally don't see any consequences.

pros: Nice campus and friendly peers. Everyone is like one big family, within your pay grade.
cons: The politics can be frustrating. You have to know someone to get hired full time. Job security is low for part timers, which this college runs on.

review_title: Growing and serving the citizens of Lorain County
pros: Close to home, good benefits currently.  Plenty of work to be done, not a lazy atmosphere.
cons: Culture is in a state of transition.  The larger the institution gets the less family-like it becomes.

pros: Wonderful community of faculty and staff. Many department supervisors work with your schedule.
cons: Not many hiring opportunities. You have to know someone to get into the  college. The faculty is staffed by majority of adjunct faculty.

review_title: Not very important. Inernal relations are good.
pros: All facilities are in a very good conditions. Good internal atmosphere between student and teachers. Flexible with respect to schedule. Teaching schedule is well and reasonably developed.
cons: Very discriminative with respect to teacher age.

review_title: student worker at the fitness center
pros: Great staff, fun environment, and good hours
cons: Standing for long periods of time

review_title: I enjoyed working at LCCC; however, opportunities are limited.
pros: Admin is extremely supportive of staff and students.
cons: No room for advancement at the college.
